name: Goldbach's conjecture
rephrased: Every even number greater than two can be expressed as the sum of two prime numbers.
implication_form: If a number is even and greater than two, then it can be written as the sum of two prime numbers.
explained: Goldbach's conjecture states that every even natural number greater than 2 can be expressed as the sum of two prime numbers. This conjecture has been verified for all even numbers up to 4 × 10¹⁸ but remains unproven for all larger even numbers.
related_conjectures: Goldbach's weak conjecture (every odd integer greater than 5 can be expressed as the sum of three primes)
